name: Anti-inflammatory
description:
Omega-3s are essential fatty acids that act as your body's cellular toolkit for balance and repair. They work by integrating into every cell membrane, keeping them flexible for efficient nerve signaling, which is crucial for a healthy Autonomic Nervous System (ANS). This promotes a calming parasympathetic ("rest and digest") state to counteract the "fight or flight" stress response. As powerful anti-inflammatories, they also help resolve chronic inflammation, a root cause of many diseases.

This dual action on the nervous system and inflammation allows Omega-3s to provide benefits across a wide range of health areas, including:

* **Cardiovascular Health:** Hardening of the Arteries (Atherosclerosis), High Triglycerides, Heart Attack, and Stroke.
* **Neurological & Mental Health:** Cognitive Decline, Depression, Bipolar Disorder, ADHD, and Nerve Health.
* **Inflammatory & Autoimmune Conditions:** Rheumatoid Arthritis, Lupus, Crohn's Disease, and Acne.
* **Metabolic Health & Other Conditions:** Type 2 Diabetes, Insulin Resistance, Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease, Asthma, and Dry Eye Syndrome.

name: Nitric Oxide
description:
Nitric oxide is a gas that acts as a universal messenger in your body. It helps relax and widen blood vessels, which increases circulation, lowers blood pressure, and improves blood flow to all your organs. Your body uses nitric oxide to send signals through the nervous system, support immune function, reduce inflammation, and protect against cellular damage. Healthy nitric oxide levels are essential for cardiovascular health, cognitive function, and maintaining a proper balance in your autonomic nervous system.

Increasing nitric oxide levels through diet, supplements, or lifestyle changes has been shown to be a beneficial therapy for a wide range of diseases and conditions, including:

* **Cardiovascular Health:** Hardening of the Arteries (Atherosclerosis), Endothelial Dysfunction, Heart Failure, High Blood Pressure (Hypertension), Peripheral Artery Disease, Stroke.
* **Neurological & Mental Health:** Brain Fog (Cognitive Difficulties).
* **Metabolic Health:** Type 1 & 2 Diabetes, Erectile Dysfunction.
* **Immune & Inflammatory Health:** Infections (Bacterial & Viral), Cancer, Inflammation and Arthritis, Wound and Burn Healing.
* **Other Conditions:** Cystic Fibrosis, Osteoporosis.

name: Antioxidants
description:
Oxidative stress is an imbalance in your body between damaging molecules called free radicals and the antioxidants that neutralize them. While your body naturally produces some free radicals, an excess from factors like poor diet, stress, and environmental toxins can damage your cells, energy-producing mitochondria, and DNA. This damage can accelerate aging and contribute to chronic disease. Maintaining a healthy balance by boosting your antioxidant defenses helps protect your cells, support energy production, and promote overall wellness.

Reducing oxidative stress may be a therapeutic approach for the following:

* **Neurological & Mental Health:** Alzheimer's Disease, Autism, Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, Fibromyalgia, Huntington's Disease, Migraine, Multiple Sclerosis, Neuropsychiatric Disorders (Depression, Bipolar Disorder), Parkinson's Disease, Stroke.
* **Cardiovascular Health:** Hardening of the Arteries (Atherosclerosis), Cardiovascular Disease, Heart Failure, High Blood Pressure (Hypertension).
* **Metabolic Health:** Diabetes.
* **Other Conditions:** Cancer, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD), Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS), Liver Disease.

name: Diet
description:
The Mediterranean diet is a heart-healthy eating pattern inspired by the traditional foods of countries bordering the Mediterranean Sea. It's rich in plant-based foods like vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and nuts, with olive oil as the primary source of fat and fish as the main protein. This way of eating helps reduce inflammation and oxidative stress, which supports your cardiovascular system and promotes a healthy balance in your autonomic nervous system for better mood, cognitive function, and overall wellness.

Adopting this diet has been shown to be beneficial for a wide range of health conditions, including:

* **Cardiovascular Health:** Cardiovascular Disease, Coronary Heart Disease, Heart Attack, Stroke, High Blood Pressure (Hypertension), High Cholesterol, Endothelial Dysfunction.
* **Neurological & Mental Health:** Cognitive Decline, Dementia, Alzheimer's Disease, Parkinson's Disease, Depression.
* **Metabolic Health:** Type 2 Diabetes, Obesity, Weight Management, Metabolic Syndrome.
* **Other Conditions:** All-Cause Mortality, Cancer (Overall, Colorectal, Breast, Prostate), Asthma, Erectile Dysfunction, Chronic Inflammation, Bone Fractures.

name: Exercise
description:
Exercise is much more than a workout; it's an active lifestyle essential for keeping your body in balance. The right amount of exercise is an antioxidant. Regular physical activity is one of the best ways to regulate your autonomic nervous system, improving communication between your brain, organs, and muscles. This helps elevate your mood, promote restorative sleep, reduce stress, and strengthen your immune system. However, even healthy moderate to strenuous exercise can be perceived as an unhealthy stressor with certain autonomic disorders. This is why "low and slow" exercise can be recommended, with the goal of gently stimulating sympathetic activity and retraining the autonomic nervous system to react normally to stresses, rather than seeing exercise as a threat.

Following an appropriate exercise regimen can help address:

* **Neurological & Mental Health:** Depression, Anxiety, Stress, Cognitive Decline (Dementia & Alzheimer's Disease), Autonomic Nervous System Dysfunction.
* **Cardiovascular Health:** Heart Disease, Stroke, High Blood Pressure (Hypertension).
* **Metabolic Health:** Type 2 Diabetes, Metabolic Syndrome, Obesity.
* **Bone & Joint Health:** Arthritis & Osteoporosis.
* **Other Conditions:** Cancer, Sleep Disorders (Insomnia & Sleep Apnea).

name: Stress Reduction
description:
Psychosocial stress is your body's response to mental and emotional pressure. This response involves your nervous, endocrine, and immune systems. Chronic stress keeps your sympathetic nervous system—your "fight-or-flight" response—overactive, which can disrupt the balance with your parasympathetic "rest-and-digest" system. This imbalance can lead to persistent inflammation and elevated stress hormones like cortisol, negatively impacting your heart, metabolism, and mental well-being. Managing stress is crucial for maintaining proper autonomic balance and overall health.

Learning to manage stress can be therapeutic for conditions such as:

* **Cardiovascular Health:** Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction), Stroke, Stress-Induced Cardiomyopathy ("Broken Heart" Syndrome), Irregular Heartbeats (Ventricular Arrhythmias, Atrial Fibrillation), Long QT Syndrome, High Blood Pressure (Hypertension).
* **Neurological & Mental Health:** Depression, Anxiety, Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), Dementia, Headaches & Migraines, Epilepsy & Seizures.
* **Metabolic Health:** Metabolic Syndrome, Type 2 Diabetes.
* **Inflammatory & Autoimmune Conditions:** Autoimmune and Inflammatory Diseases.
* **Other Conditions:** Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), Fibromyalgia & Chronic Pain Syndromes.
